name: SEER Primary Tumor
title: SEER Primary Tumor
footnotes:
\##    Considered regional in Historic Stage 
\###  Considered distant in Historic Stage
rows:
Localized only

Invasive tumor confined to one of the following subsites:

     Anterior wall (including vallecula and lingual (anterior) surface of epiglottis)
     One lateral wall
     Posterior wall

Involvement of two or more subsites:

     Anterior,  lateral or posterior wall(s)##

Localized, NOS

Tumor confined to mucosa of anterior surface of epiglottis with normal vocal cord mobility 

Tumor confined to mucosa of adjacent subsite(s) of oropharynx

Soft tissue, NOS

Tumor confined to mucosa of vallecula WITHOUT fixation of larynx

Mucosa of pyriform sinus, medial wall or NOS WITHOUT fixation of larynx

Stated as T3, T4 or T4a with no other information on extension

Regional by direct extension only

Extension to:

     Base of tongue
     Buccal mucosa (inner cheek)###
     Floor of mouth###
     Gum (gingiva)###
     Hypopharynx, NOS
     Larynx, NOS
     Nasopharynx, NOS###
     Posterior surface of epiglottis
     Prevertebral fascia or muscle
     Pterygoid muscle
     Pyriform sinus (pyriform fossa)

Soft palate:

     Inferior surface
     Superior (nasopharyngeal) surface
     Uvula

Soft tissue of neck

Fixation to adjacent tissues

Mucosa of adjacent subsite(s) of supraglottis (including posterior surface of epiglottis) WITHOUT fixation of larynx  

Mucosa of larynx, glottis or NOS WITHOUT fixation of larynx

Mucosa of base of tongue WITHOUT fixation of larynx

Paraglottic space
Pre-epiglottic tissues

Postcricoid area
Pyriform sinus except medial wall

Unknown; extension not stated
Primary tumor cannot be assessed
Not documented in patient record
